derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: shortening of Old French espine, or from Latin spina 'thorn, prickle, backbone'

entry.def: Your spine is the row of bones down your back.
The spine of a book is the narrow stiff part which the pages and covers are attached to.

entry.tran: (动物身体上的)棘状突起;(植物上的)棘，刺，针
entry.def: Spines are also long, sharp points on an animal's body or on a plant.

means.word_mean: 1. the series of vertebrae forming the axis of the skeleton and protecting the spinal cord;
3. a sharp-pointed tip on a stem or leaf
4. a sharp rigid animal process or appendage; as a porcupine quill or a ridge on a bone or a ray of a fish fin
